title: Remove zstd in anticipation for it being re-added through marble
body: zstd should not be used on the write-ahead log, but only on large blocks of items with a custom dictionary, which is provided by the [marble](https://github.com/komora-io/marble) crate that sled's storage is being restructured on top of.

title: Remove old io_uring support before rewrite
Remove extremely outdated neon and python bindings
Prevent UB with `assume_init` on uninit bytes
body: If `size_of::<F>` < `size_of::<Data>`, the remaining bytes would be uninitialised - thus, calling `assume_init` would cause UB, as noted by Miri. Storing the data as `MaybeUninit` and casting to the correct `FnOnce()` object before reading it fixes this, only using initialized bytes.

title: Require threads on all platforms.
body: This change has been a long time coming, as needing to punt all maintenance work to any caller thread over time has really caused a lot of code complexity around logging and garbage collection to build-up. This change reasserts what sled began as, which is an embedded database with its first aim being to support higher scale distributed stateful systems, which will stand to benefit dramatically from being able to rely on thread support for specific logging and GC functionality over time. This change primarily unlocks some logging changes that I'd like to implement soon that should really simplify the writepath.

title: Update parking_lot requirement from 0.11.1 to 0.12.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [parking_lot](https://github.com/Amanieu/parking_lot) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from parking_lot's changelog.

parking_lot 0.12.0, parking_lot_core 0.9.0, lock_api 0.4.6 (2022-01-28)

  • The MSRV is bumped to 1.49.0.
  • Disabled eventual fairness on wasm32-unknown-unknown. (#302)
  • Added a rwlock method to report if lock is held exclusively. (#303)
  • Use new asm! macro. (#304)
  • Use windows-rs instead of winapi for faster builds. (#311)
  • Moved hardware lock elision support to a separate Cargo feature. (#313)
  • Removed used of deprecated spin_loop_hint. (#314)

parking_lot 0.11.2, parking_lot_core 0.8.4, lock_api 0.4.5 (2021-08-28)

  • Fixed incorrect memory orderings on RwLock and WordLock. (#294, #292)
  • Added Arc-based lock guards. (#291)
  • Added workaround for TSan's lack of support for fence. (#292)

lock_api 0.4.4 (2021-05-01)

  • Update for latest nightly. (#281)

lock_api 0.4.3 (2021-04-03)

  • Added [Raw]ReentrantMutex::is_owned. (#280)

parking_lot_core 0.8.3 (2021-02-12)

  • Updated smallvec to 1.6. (#276)

parking_lot_core 0.8.2 (2020-12-21)

  • Fixed assertion failure on OpenBSD. (#270)

parking_lot_core 0.8.1 (2020-12-04)

  • Removed deprecated CloudABI support. (#263)
  • Fixed build on wasm32-unknown-unknown. (#265)
  • Relaxed dependency on smallvec. (#266)

parking_lot 0.11.1, lock_api 0.4.2 (2020-11-18)

  • Fix bounds on Send and Sync impls for lock guards. (#262)
  • Fix incorrect memory ordering in RwLock. (#260)

lock_api 0.4.1 (2020-07-06)

  • Add data_ptr method to lock types to allow unsafely accessing the inner data without a guard. (#247)

parking_lot 0.11.0, parking_lot_core 0.8.0, lock_api 0.4.0 (2020-06-23)

title: Fixes 32 bits systems compatibility
body:
The build was failing when `size_of::<usize> < 8` with the error "this arithmetic operation will overflow".

This error is not emitted when running "cargo check" and hence not caught by the CI.

title: Use const generics for IVec::from array
body: This will move the minimum supported rust version to 1.51, which may or may not be acceptable.

title: Fix: insert deadlock #1380
body:
After 1024 insertions of the same key-value pair, the SyncSender blocks.

This fixes issue #1380

title: apply cargo clippy fix
body:
By using cargo clippy on normal mode and with the testing feature on, I got rid of some cargo warnings that I got out of my own build and that of the pipeline.

The only warning I could not get through was on src/result.rs file on 84. So the fix was instead of cloning the bt variable, I just dereferenced it. But this made compiling with testing feature not work.

title: improve binary search
body: this corresponds to the [improvements in std which made binary search's best case performance O(1)](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/74024).

title: reduced size tracking and error handling rework
body: this is a significant step towards pointer swizzling support, as well as addresses several correctness issues that have been discovered through increased fault injection (the `pwrite partial` failpoint in particular has caused a number of interesting bugs to pop out).

title: Upgrade to GitHub-native Dependabot

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
_Dependabot Preview will be shut down on August 3rd, 2021. In order to keep getting Dependabot updates, please merge this PR and migrate to GitHub-native Dependabot before then._

Dependabot has been fully integrated into GitHub, so you no longer have to install and manage a separate app. This pull request migrates your configuration from Dependabot.com to a config file, using the [new syntax][new_syntax]. When merged, we'll swap out `dependabot-preview` (me) for a new `dependabot` app, and you'll be all set!

With this change, you'll now use the [Dependabot page in GitHub][dependabot_page], rather than the [Dependabot dashboard][dashboard], to monitor your version updates, and you'll configure Dependabot through the new config file rather than a UI.


You have configured automerging on this repository. There is no automerging support in GitHub-native Dependabot, so these settings will not be added to the new config file. Several 3rd-party GitHub Actions and bots can replicate the automerge feature.





If you've got any questions or feedback for us, please let us know by creating an issue in the [dependabot/dependabot-core][issues] repository.

[Learn more about migrating to GitHub-native Dependabot][learn]

Please note that regular `@dependabot` commands do not work on this pull request.

[dashboard]: https://app.dependabot.com/
[dependabot_page]: https://github.com/spacejam/sled/network/updates
[issues]: https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/issues/new?assignees=%40dependabot%2Fpreview-migration-reviewers&labels=E%3A+preview-migration&template=migration-issue.md
[learn]: http://docs.github.com/code-security/supply-chain-security/upgrading-from-dependabotcom-to-github-native-dependabot
[new_syntax]: https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates
[org_secrets_url]: https://github.com/settings/secrets/dependabot
[repo_secrets_url]: https://github.com/spacejam/sled/settings/secrets/dependabot

title: never spawn work from the threadpool back into the threadpool queue
body: While performing work in a threadpool, always perform spawned work inline instead of chucking it into a queue, which could cause cyclical write stabilization dependencies. This should avoid some deadlock risk that I've been thinking may be possible.

title: Make subscription mutable so we can call next_timeout on it
Add information about flush to the docs. Closes #1302.
bump msrv to 1.46, use matches!, use cfg_attr instead of hard-deny to avoid future breakage
Update zstd requirement from 0.6.0 to 0.7.0

title: Feature/resolve tree contains
body:
This PR is used to simplify the contains_tree to a simple bool instead of a result.

Edit note: This PR has also a cargo fmt applied to it, to make it more readable.

title: Store pending oneshot for subscriber future
body:
Fixes https://github.com/spacejam/sled/issues/1313

Add a field on Subscriber to store a oneshot after getting a pending poll. It's possible we'll need to pull some extra waker shenanigans in order to ensure we wake up when the oneshot becomes ready, but I'm not versed enough in this codebase to know that yet.
This change also removes an unneeded use of `unsafe` (I think this is fine, but let me know if it was there for a reason)

title: Add a method that gives a subscriber where the channel size can be chosen
body: This PR is made to address the issue https://github.com/spacejam/sled/issues/1177. It gives a 2nd method to watch_prefix to get a subscriber given a prefix. But the method gives the choice to decide how large the subscriber channel is. I have also used the line, cargo fmt this means it also includes a reformatted code.

title: Add contains_tree method to the Db, related to issue 1297
body: Hello guys, this is my 1st contribution to the sled embedded database. This PR is to add a method to the db struct to be able to see if there is already a tree with that name in the database.

title: Add failpoints that skip and perform partial writes
Add some metrics on the various types of log messages being reserved
Rewrite dirty pages on page-out to reduce storage size
use im for immutable tree overlays
Remove some usage of concurrency control where it may not be necessar…
body: …y. Reduce memory consumption during tree removal operations.

title: Avoid creating a new pids set when transitioning a segment from active to inactive
Avoid removing and re-adding an item to the Lru upon cache access
feat: Enable the flusher for iOS
body:
Hey there! Congrats on the awesome crate 🎉 .
While coding something on iOS we noticed the changes were not being synced.
From some commit messages I found that the rationale behind the cfg gate was to only enable the flusher in platforms with support for threads. This enables the flusher for iOS.

I can add some docs if that's a goal, just not sure where given that `Config`'s `flush_every_ms` options is `#[doc(hidden)]`.

title: Use a Relaxed atomic counter when determining when to take a fuzzy sn…
body: …apshot

title: node enhancements
body:
* node can now store up to 2^32 children
* values of fixed length 0 are now properly omitted, allowing both keys and values to potentially collapse to a single header, lo key and hi key storing all information for a node

title: contention reductions
body: by reducing contention, we also significantly reduce memory usage as this causes far less build-up in the threadpool and in the EBR collector

title: Add a specific truncation thread to make dependency loops between the…
body: … SA and blocking IO impossible

title: Only initiate tree node splits and merges if we've looped less than 3…
body: … times while looking up a node for a key

title: Import crossbeam-epoch and crossbeam-utils, simplify some things, get…
body: … rid of unused code, and perform dynamic collection when garbage grows large to better tame memory blow-ups when they happen.

title: Significantly simplify threadpool, and use different threads for diff…
body: …erent kinds of work to avoid dependency cycles.

title: Avoid allocations while processing mark_replace in SA
avoid expensive EBR guard interactions with SA mutex
avoid long pins on snapshot generation
body: Most memory blow-up issues stem from something holding on to a crossbeam-epoch guard for too long. This addresses one of the offenders.

title: Cut IVec size down to 8 bytes
vendor fnv
body: provides minor compile-time optimizations. provides better hashing throughput on 8-byte PageId's which tend to be hashmap keys.

title: Remove custom Arc implementation. Fold single-rc into much simpler IVec rewrite.
Remove the IVec::subslice functionality
body: This is removed because it serves no practical use over an external wrapper type that simply maintains the subslice information externally, yet this adds some complexity, and the panic tests were always annoying to see in the logs.

title: Remove the rest of the deprecated functions scattered throughout the codebase
Add public print_profile function when the metrics feature is enabled
Use an in-memory overlay for receiving node updates before merging them into the backing NodeInner in a batch
body:
This reduces the update pressure for contiguous nodes by buffering updates in an in-memory "overlay" that sits on top of an Arc-wrapped contiguous Node, and only when the node is rewritten due to GC or reaching the max frag threshold will it be consolidated in one go. 

This essentially maps the overlay to Link updates, and the backing NodeInner to fully rewritten nodes.

title: Disable everything related to metrics if the feature is disabled
body: From my measurements this decreases memory usage by more than 20 MB

title: Restrict visibility of some Node functionality
pagecache simplifications
body: Make get_meta and get_idgen infallible. Make PageTable::get always return a PageView, as allocate enforces that pages are present at all times with an allocation mutex

title: Extend some doccomments based on Github discussions
single-allocation nodes
body:
this large update changes how tree nodes are represented:
* a single contiguous allocation for a node's metadata, keys, and values
* variable offset and length bytes
* avoids offset tables when keys and values are fixed length
* combines offset tables when keys and values are both variable length
* zero additional serialization / deserialization effort
* likely addresses cache sizing problems

over time, this makes it easy to take advantage of
* eytzinger layouts #1219 
* cheaper cache accounting
* far more compact in-memory representations
* essentially free serialization

# todo

- [x] reimplement prefix encoding
- [x] reimplement suffix truncation
- [ ] Arc<[u8]> with views to facilitate zero-copy reads
- [x] compare cpu profiles
- [x] compare memory profiles, assert cache size is better respected now
- [ ] optimize delta application

title: ALICE fixes
body:
See also #1077. This branch holds the changes I've made thus far in response to issues found by ALICE. The entire test setup can be found at https://github.com/divergentdave/alice-sled, including a git submodule pointing to this branch.

Currently I'm not getting any more reports from the tool, though I haven't waited long enough for it to terminate yet. I would like to expand the workload and checker to exercise more functionality. For example, I expect we'll at least need more fsyncs in the heap directory.

Big picture, it would be good to turn each crash recovery test into a workload/checker pair, where the workload somehow serializes the equivalent of the test's reference data structure to stdout, and the checker reads stdout to reconstruct the reference data structure, and verify if the particular durability invariant was maintained in the database.

title: Use exclusive concurrency control + atomic write batch while dropping trees
multithread crash tests
body: fyi @divergentdave this speeds up testing a little by running the crash tests in parallel

title: properly fsync writes to file tips
small refactor of miri no hole punching
body: cc @divergentdave I've taken your conditional compilation and consolidated it with the existing conditional compilation at the top of punch_hole's body

title: Don't try to call fallocate in Miri
body: `libc::fallocate` does not have a shim implemented in Miri, this small patch conditionally disables hole punching in Miri to avoid calling it.

title: Add filtering and stderr output to no-harness test
body:
This PR improves the ergonomics of the test_crash_recovery test. Since this integration test has `harness = false` set, it is up to us to handle test filtering, console output, etc. These changes add console output that approximates what we see from the standard library test harness, and allow filtering out tests using the same command line argument interface. Sample output:

```
david@desktop:~/Code/sled$ cargo test --features=testing -- crash_tx
    Finished test [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.05s
     Running target/debug/deps/sled-e06fd382104117c8

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 29 filtered out

     Running target/debug/deps/test_crash_recovery-83cd0a124e744f4b

running 1 test
test crash_tx ... ok

test result: ok. 1 passed; 3 filtered out

     Running target/debug/deps/test_log-440f4f40cf3c48f3

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 7 filtered out
...
```

title: Fix bug with fuzzy snapshotting. Closes #1209
Use sync_file_range instead of fsync for heap writes on linux
Update rand_chacha requirement from 0.2.2 to 0.3.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [rand_chacha](https://github.com/rust-random/rand) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from rand_chacha's changelog.

[0.3.0] - 2015-03-25

Changed

  • Update to use log version 0.3.x

[0.2.1] - 2015-03-22

Fixed

  • Compatible with Rust master
  • Fixed iOS compilation

[0.2.0] - 2015-03-06

Fixed

  • Compatible with Rust master (move from old_io to std::io)

[0.1.4] - 2015-03-04

Fixed

  • Compatible with Rust master (use wrapping ops)

[0.1.3] - 2015-02-20

Fixed

  • Compatible with Rust master

Removed

  • Removed Copy implementations from RNGs

[0.1.2] - 2015-02-03

Added

  • Imported functionality from std::rand, including:
    • StdRng, SeedableRng, TreadRng, weak_rng()
    • ReaderRng: A wrapper around any Reader to treat it as an RNG.
  • Imported documentation from std::rand
  • Imported tests from std::rand

[0.1.1] - 2015-02-03

Added

  • Migrate to a cargo-compatible directory structure.

Fixed

  • Do not use entropy during gen_weighted_bool(1)

[Rust 0.12.0] - 2014-10-09

Added

  • Impl Rand for tuples of arity 11 and 12
  • Include ChaCha pseudorandom generator
Commits
  • 98e220c Merge pull request #1072 from dhardy/work
  • 95fea0e Fix link in README; rename keyword as suggested in #1073
  • 459d863 Prepare rand_chacha 0.3.0 release
  • 15aebf4 Prepare rand_pcg 0.3.0
  • 14c2016 Prepare rand_hc 0.3.0
  • d95dbd2 Prepare rand_core 0.6.0
  • 6682db1 Merge pull request #1073 from rust-random/work2
  • 33b8f37 Address review: use assert_almost_eq macro
  • 354468e Use approximate assertions in value stability and increase some tolerences sl...
  • 33a78de Add cross test (inspired by ndarray CI)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Properly handle failpoints in the tree verification logic
